title: Did Paul McCartney ever cheat on Linda? - Quora

response.answer_text: The answer is NO.  And that was a remarkable change of character for this rock star who hit it off with so many ardent fans that the numbers were legendary. This was according to the massive “Paul McCartney” biography that came out in 2016 and was written by Philip Norman who focused on documenting the Beatle star' s girlfriends, loves and lovers through the decades. Even when on a 5-year relationship with Jane Asher, Paul had on the side actress Peggy Lipton (of Mod Squad), Marianne Faithfull nannies Maggie McGovern and Apple music employee Francie Schwartz. And even these four were not enough for his raging libido, according to the book. But when he met Linda, she was able to do what no woman prior to her could do; keep Paul faithful. The author made intensive research into Paul and Linda's relationship, interviewing countless people close to them and had come up with the conclusion that there was never any suggestion throughout their 30-year union that Paul was anything but faithful. I'm sure that if the author found or uncovered any hint of unfaithfulness, he'd be happy to write about it for those were the kind of juicy scoops that sell books. I have a number of books about McCartney, some I bought and some were given to me as gifts, and in none of these books was there a mention or even a hint of McCartney cheating on Linda. I thought that if there is one book that would divulge such incident, it would be this Philip Norman book since he focused on his love life but NADA. Thank you

upvoters.user_id: Bárbara Augusta M. Martins e Silva

response.answer_text: Questions like this drive me absolutely crazy. He is an artist, a legend, a man who shares a gift with the world that happens to be visible through music-a genre that touches our hearts. In turn how dare anyone think that we deserve to pry into his most personal aspects of his life as we do to most celebrities. And falsely I might add. I just don’t get it. And no don’t tell me it is just human nature. If I believed that then I wouldn’t have adopted it (learning to treat celebrities with respect) as one of the goals of my non profit: The International Foundation for Performing Arts Medicine. Someone else posted a question asking if he beat Linda. These types of questions, I believe, come from very envious people who somehow have put celebrities into a different category. They no longer see them as people who excel at something -something that happens to be very visible and very much a part of our day to day. Hey folks, they put their pants on one leg at a time just like you and me. They only posts these questions because they themselves have a low self esteem probably and the only way they can feel good about themselves is to tear someone else down. Celebrities are easy targets. Guess what? Their wealth doesn’t necessarily make their lives that much different than ours except physical possessions. Case in point. I worked at the Kessler Institute for Rehabilitation when Christopher Reeves was a patient there. Screen Actor Guild’s insurance wasn’t a great insurance plan and didn’t cover a lot of equipment he needed. The only difference was his famous friends had money to help pay for things he needed and many companies wanted to give him things for free in exchange for his endorsements. Again holding out a carrot of badly needed equipment because he was famous. Something just didn’t sit right about that with any of the staff including myself. Reminds me of celebrity magazines writing stories or taking incidences out of context simply to sell more. It’s abusive and will stop if WE stop. We can all help by not buying these magazines. That might be a great start. This just hits home with me. Sorry if I am going on and on and thanks for reading my words.

No one really knows except Paul himself. Only a woman could believe that he never cheated. However, Linda had legendary oral abilities, famed throughout the 1960’s rock n’ roll scene, and I’m certainly not talking about her singing ability. “My love does it good” indeed, and their sex life, along with her being the mother of his children and a fellow lover of cannabis, cannot be overestimated. Same with Ronald Reagan and Nancy Reagan (not so much the cannabis part), who was notorious in 1940’s Hollywood for not only her bad acting but her fellatio skills, back when she was a young starlet named Nancy Davis. Women really don’t get it about men and oral sex. Guys, flame me all that you wish, but you ESPECIALLY know I am correct.

Paul is not known to have cheated on Linda once they were married in early 1969. Both of them had settled down considerably from wilder times. If Paul had, it would have come out by now. The Beatles are probably the most written about musicians on earth. When Paul and Linda first met (mid-1967), he was about to be engaged to Jane Asher, though in all other respects their relationship was in decline. In the unlikely chance the questioner wants to know about this, Paul was with a great many women after he met Linda, but before Jane and Paul broke off their engagement, and before Paul and Linda began their committed relationship. Paul and Linda famously never spent a night apart except a number of days Paul was required to stay in Japan.

I agree the answer is no because Linda was the love of his life. While everyone wants to talk about the love between John and Yoko it has been proven that that relationship was kind of a sham and that by 73 they were no so happy and close to divorce. Paul and Linda were the real love story. Paul was the one on tour that always seemed to be in trouble for sleeping with groupies and having a lot of women although this was kept as quiet as possible. When Paul met Linda that all changed and he knew he had found someone that he wanted to spend the rest of his life with. Had Linda not died so early in life I have no doubt that they would still be together.  Even in 2015 he was still remembering Linda and honoring her,

If we are to believe that these two never spent more than a handful of days apart throughout the duration of their marriage, then I must lean towards no. Of course, what we are told and what is actually so can be two separate things. Only Paul knows if he ever laid with another woman throughout his marriage, but what we do know is there are no public accounts of him ever slipping up and out. A man as busy as him probably does not have much idle time, so entertaining love affairs would not be practical or in character, especially considering his family always cocooned him. I believe McCartney’s active days were bountiful, but when he found that insulation in Linda, that comfort that he lost with his own mother, he knew he couldn’t let go.

Hello. The simple answer is “No”. Aside from the few nights Paul spent in jail in Japan in 1980 having tried to smuggle pot into the country in his luggage, Paul and Linda never spent a night apart from each other. This lack of separation was something Linda would secretly complain about to friends; but she stood by Paul. Paul was very devoted to Linda because she was there when he needed someone the most (post Beatle breakup) and she never let him get away with the rockstar nonsense around her. He treated Linda as his girlfriend throughout their marriage, bringing her flowers from the garden and having date nights etc. Paul never treated another woman like that again. She was really his one true love.

I am not aware that Paul McCartney did anything inappropriate to Linda. They had a very loving together relationship which lasted until the day she died. This question is a very leading question which, like many questions to do with Paul McCartney are based on misleading rumours and untruths. I am just putting an addition here. The original question was something like”what inappropriate things did Paul do to Linda” The question was changed which may make my answer seem as though it is phrased a bit peculiar.

Of course we have no way of knowing, but I believe he didn’t. Not only did they love each other, but they seemed to respect each other and their relationship highly. They were a true partnership in the best sense of the word and they built a life together that was far more valuable than any sexual dalliance he could possibly have been interested in. So, in my opinion, no, nope, no way.

I’d say it’s highly unlikely that he did. There was a least one article published after Linda’s death where Paul claims that they only ever spent one night apart during their entire marriage. In their 30 years together Linda and Paul spent only one night apart Marrying a Beatle was a match made in heaven

Probably. Imagine thousands of pubescent screaming females throwing their knickers at him on a regular basis has to have had some effect. Plus recreational drugs added into the mix. He was a young fit man. Hard to resist temptation. Probably why Linda travelled with him on tours. To keep a watchful eye…
He didn't and you must be a Troll, there's a lovely bridge waiting for you to move under…  Paul and Linda McCartney
What gave you that idea? They famously had one of the most loving and enduring relationships of any celebrity couple, or ordinary couple, for that matter.

No, Paul would never have cheated on Linda. Even if he'd thought of it, they were never apart long enough. The only time they were separated for any length of time was in 1980. Paul spent 11 days in jail in Japan for marijuana possession.
As far as the public is aware, they got along great and had a wonderful long marriage. He did not cheat on her and loved her deeply. He was not inappropriate in any way.
